An eager intern encrypted the flag using RSA, but mistakenly chose both primes as Blum integers. Can you recover the plaintext? Ciphertext: 4768994067004164225623665590771154230585873742979303422999401757126278039042422150804261768747484646622434198016926343212103060194508999585661499072723290

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8196611948293725101620610085069728662698660135874041989816005301522332383668740436918212742996872092093829339751961752371957378931440884787122316985294257, e=1173818059076774406278080975424395322916966264121762551775206750231007894891390925370435843040657966580203061761486023346305165336028463956486050443688407
The lower 104 bits of p are: 54458386860413337222686886161394812271


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{rwdc0jco}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4768994067004164225623665590771154230585873742979303422999401757126278039042422150804261768747484646622434198016926343212103060194508999585661499072723290
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8196611948293725101620610085069728662698660135874041989816005301522332383668740436918212742996872092093829339751961752371957378931440884787122316985294257, e=1173818059076774406278080975424395322916966264121762551775206750231007894891390925370435843040657966580203061761486023346305165336028463956486050443688407
The lower 104 bits of p are: 54458386860413337222686886161394812271

extra_info: p=113670500644396239495353710266764304858763129956155710960135153260766037656943, q=72108523335669886457365597320366059861614145868779630317696421752759906418399, Ï†(n)=8196611948293725101620610085069728662698660135874041989816005301522332383668554657894232676870919372786242209387241375096132443590163053212108791041218916
